name: Britannia Ashley Hotel

reviews.text: We had booked a room linked to our attendance at Tatton Park Flower Show. When we arrived at the hotel, at about 5.30pm, we were given the key to a room. When we opened the door of the room, we found that it was already occupied [so much for personal security]. Returning to reception, we were given the key to another room. When we went into this room we were shocked at what we found. With three beds, it was more like a dormitory than a bedroom. Linen was dirty, the bathroom floor was dirty, the bathroom was badly stained, and there were multiple tiles missing around the washbasin. We immediately complained about this, and were told that there were no other rooms available to us. As a result we had to leave and make alternative arrangements – though having now read other reviews on this site, we are grateful that we made this escape! We have complained both to the hotel and to the chain’s head office – no response.
reviews.title: A lucky escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived I was already sceptical, the hotel was attached to a Somerfield supermarket and was a very ugly building. We were pleasently surprised however to find piles of free decent magazines and newspapers in reception and to to be told that we had free car parking (on the Somerfield car park). However that was the end of the good stuff!
reviews.title: Filthy

likes.disliked: — filthy disgusting total lack of clenliness

reviews.title: Worst 3* property ever
reviews.text: The lift interior was very dirty, although it was carpeted it didn't look like it had been vaccumed for month. On leaving the lift we practically fell over a pile of clean towels/bedding which had been dumped in the coridor.

reviews.title: Dirty Dirty Dirty
reviews.text: On entering the room we found a grotty bedroom with scratched furniture, a lamp with an enormous bulb sticking out the top, mould all over the grouting and seal around the bath. I pulled back the covers to reveal a bottom sheet which was totally covered in grey round splodges of mould stains. It was absolutely disgusting. The paint had totally peeled off the window frame, which was absolutely black with filth. The dirty grey net curtain had been either ripped or cut with some blunt scissors because the sides were not even straight. We found thick dust in many places and even wrote "Clean me" in it!!

reviews.title: Terrible hotel experience
reviews.text: 'Breakfast' was a help yourself buffet (literally to everything). The tea and coffee was in flasks on the buffet table, no toast and the fruit was tinned grapefruit and mandarins.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here to see the Genisis concert, didn't look at the reviews first, big mistake but by the time we did it was the only one left .All the previous reviews are spot on.
reviews.title: Do not stay here it was terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How this got 3 stars we will never know. The corriders were damp and paper peeling off. The first room we were given hadn't been cleaned and workmen were all over the floor trailing wires all over the place with no signs displayed.When we complained, the receptionist shouted to somone which rooms are clean !!! The second had been, well their version of it. But we had to ask for towels.Staff were poorly trained and no one appeared in charge. and although the breakfast itself was good, the service wasn't.
reviews.title: Uncool Britannia

reviews.text: The area is lovely with lots of nice restaurants and bars but would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Don't go near!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I booked this one-night stay at the last minute after deciding we wanted a change of scene that weekend. We liked the look of the area but didn't research the hotel properly - this was a mistake!
reviews.title: Yup. The other reviews are right- stay away

description: The Britannia Ashley Hotel is a modern, comfortable boutique hotel located in a prime location - the village of Hale. 67 cozy rooms, a mouthwatering selection of meals and the friendliest staff await you at the Ashley.
